Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'nutrition' to someone reading at the Middle School level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 150 words that follows your plan. 
Nutrition is the way the body uses the food we eat to keep itself healthy. Food gives our bodies the energy and nutrients we need to grow and feel good. Just like a car needs gasoline to run, our bodies need food to move and do things. The three main parts of a healthy diet are carbohydrates, proteins, and fats. Carbohydrates, like bread and fruits, give us energy. Proteins, found in foods like meat and beans, help build and repair our muscles and tissues. Fats, like those found in oils and nuts, help us absorb the good stuff in our food. We also need vitamins and minerals, like vitamin C and calcium, to stay healthy. A balanced diet, with the right amounts of these different kinds of food, will keep us strong and healthy. When we eat a variety of foods, we get all the nutrients our bodies need to function properly.

Nutrition is the way that our bodies get the food we need to stay healthy. Food gives us energy to run, play, and think. It also helps our bodies grow and repair themselves. There are six main groups of food that we need to eat every day: fruits, vegetables, proteins, grains, dairy, and fats. Fruits and vegetables are like superheroes for our bodies. They help us fight off the bad guys, like germs and sicknesses. Proteins help us build strong muscles and bones. Grains give us energy to move around. Dairy foods, like milk and cheese, help us build strong teeth and bones. Fats help our bodies work properly. We should try to eat a little bit of each group every day so our bodies can get all the nutrients they need. When we eat a balanced diet, we feel our best and are ready to take on the day!

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'nutrition' to someone reading at the Middle School level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 150 words that follows your plan. 
The human body is like a car, but instead of gasoline, it runs on food. Just like how cars need regular oil changes to keep running smoothly, our bodies need good nutrition to keep us healthy and strong. Nutrition is like fuel for our bodies. It's the food we eat that gives us energy and helps us grow and develop. Our bodies are made up of many different parts, like our muscles, bones, and skin, and each of these parts needs specific nutrients to work properly. If we don't eat enough of the right foods, we can get tired, sick, or even hurt. Eating a balanced diet that includes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins can help us stay healthy and strong. By choosing the right foods, we can give our bodies the fuel they need to run at their best.

Step 1: Think about how to explain 'nutrition' to someone reading at the Middle School level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.

Here is the paragraph:
"Nutrition is the study of how our bodies use the food we eat to stay healthy. It's like fueling a car - we put gasoline in the tank, and the car runs. Our bodies are like cars, and food is the gasoline that keeps us running. When we eat foods that are full of vitamins and minerals, like fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, our bodies use those nutrients to stay healthy. They help us grow strong bones, keep our hearts beating, and give us energy to play and have fun. On the other hand, if we eat foods that are high in sugar and fat, like candy and junk food, our bodies don't use those nutrients as well. They can even make us feel sick or tired. So, what we eat is important because it helps our bodies work properly."
